topic.title: TTM2 Trial Review: Targeted Temperature Management After Cardiac Arrest
topic.clinical_question: In adult patients with comatose out-of-hospital cardiac arrest of presumed cardiac cause, does targeted temperature management at 33°C compared with 36°C (normothermia with early treatment of fever) reduce mortality or improve neurological outcomes at 6 months?

trial_reference.title: Hypothermia versus Normothermia after Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrest

topic.scope_notes: Focus on the evolution of temperature management evidence from TTM to TTM2. Include discussion of why results differed from earlier studies. Address implications for Australian practice.

additional_resources.notes: Current Australian guidance on post-resuscitation temperature management
